intro: Schultesiophytum, commonly known as the African ice plant, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its fleshy leaves and flowers. The plant has a low-growing, mat-forming structure with thick, bluish-green leaves that store water. Its small, star-shaped flowers are typically pink or purple and bloom in summer. Schultesiophytum is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water once established.
